SENT.plain: The selective vulnerability of distinct neuronal structures is a major feature of Machado-Joseph disease (MJD), also known as spinocerebellar ataxia 3 (SCA3)
Vestibular dysfunction is known to be a symptom of MJD, but little is known about precisely when the vestibular system becomes impaired
Using a caloric test, we evaluated vestibular function in 2 MJD patients
One developed the initial symptom 1 year before evaluation, and the other 3 years before evaluation
Neither demonstrated a bilateral response in electronystagmography using ice-cold water irrigation, indicating severe vestibular disturbance
These results suggest that vestibular dysfunction is a symptom that develops very early in MJD and may contribute to unsteady gait as the initial symptom
The vestibular system thus appears to be one of the structures most vulnerable to MJD
